subject: RE: [junit] junit help
msgSnippet: ... Even though I agree with the what is said above, if you really need to test some private method in ernest, you could implement your TestCase as an inner
messageBody:
> > 2) how to check the private methods in java. for example i have a
>
> JUnit cannot test private methods. Only test public methods (and your
> private methods are certainly called from the public one)

Even though I agree with the what is said above, if you really need to
test some private method in ernest, you could implement your TestCase as
an inner class (see
http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/javatips/jw-javatip106.html).

Manuel Amago.
